fields.name: Usage: /math <inputs>
fields.value: This command will perform calculations (specified by **inputs**) for you and display the result(s).

fields.name: Usage: /math <inputs> [hide]
fields.value: Setting the **hide** option to true will cause the result(s) to be visible to only you.

fields.name: X + Y
fields.value: Adds **X** and **Y** together.

fields.name: X - Y
fields.value: Subtracts **Y** from **X**.

fields.name: X * Y
fields.value: Multiplies **X** by **Y**.

fields.name: X / Y
fields.value: Divides **X** by **Y**.

fields.name: X // Y
fields.value: Divides **X** by **Y**, then rounds the result down. For example, **5 // 2** returns **2** instead of **2.5**.

fields.name: X % Y
fields.value: Returns the division remainder of two numbers. For example, **10 % 3** returns **1**.

fields.name: X ^ Y
fields.value: Returns **X** raised to the Y power. For example, **3 ^ 4** returns 81.

fields.name: X == Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** equals **Y**. Returns **false** otherwise.

fields.name: X != Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** does not equal **Y**. Returns **false** otherwise.

fields.name: X < Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** is less than **Y**. Returns **false** otherwise.

fields.name: X > Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** is greater than **Y**. Returns **false** otherwise.

fields.name: X <= Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** is less than or equal to **Y**. Returns **false** otherwise.

fields.name: X >= Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** is greater than or equal to **Y**. Returns **false** otherwise.

fields.name: X && Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if both X and Y are true. Returns **false** otherwise. **X** and **Y** must be booleans.

fields.name: X || Y
fields.value: Returns **true** if either X or Y are true. Returns **false** otherwise. **X** and **Y** must be booleans.

fields.name: !X
fields.value: Returns **true** if **X** is false. **X** must be a boolean.

fields.name: (X)
fields.value: Operations in parentheses are evaluated before other operations.

fields.name: X ? Y : Z
fields.value: If **X** is true, returns **Y**. Otherwise, returns **Z**.

fields.name: X = Y
fields.value: Stores the value of the right side to the variable on the left.

fields.name: true
fields.value: Evaluates to true.

fields.name: false
fields.value: Evaluates to false.

fields.name: XdY
fields.value: Rolls **X** dice with **Y** faces.

fields.name: XdY[dlN][dhM][u]
fields.value: The drop lowest, drop highest, or unique modifiers can be used on dice rolls. If used, the unique modifier must come last.

fields.name: sqrt(X)
fields.value: Returns the square root of **X**.

fields.name: ln(X)
fields.value: Returns the natural log of **X**.

fields.name: sin(X)
fields.value: Returns the sine of **X**.

fields.name: cos(X)
fields.value: Returns the cosine of **X**.

fields.name: tan(X)
fields.value: Returns the tangent of **X**.

fields.name: floor(X)
fields.value: Returns **X** rounded down to the nearest integer.

fields.name: ceil(X)
fields.value: Returns **X** rounded up to the nearest integer.

fields.name: trunc(X)
fields.value: Returns **X** rounded towards zero.

fields.name: abs(X)
fields.value: Returns the absolute value of **X**.

fields.name: fact(X)
fields.value: Returns the factorial of **X**.
